name: Voyager 1
blurb: First probe to reach interstellar space. Launched to study the outer planets, it continues to send data from beyond our solar system.

name: Voyager 2
blurb: Only spacecraft to visit all four outer planets. Provided unprecedented views of Uranus and Neptune.

name: Hubble Space Telescope
blurb: Revolutionary space telescope that transformed our understanding of the universe and helped discover exoplanets.

name: Kepler Space Telescope
blurb: Discovered thousands of exoplanets using the transit method. Proved that Earth-sized planets are common.

name: Spitzer Space Telescope
blurb: Infrared space telescope that studied exoplanet atmospheres and characterized their compositions.

name: TESS
blurb: Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite continues Kepler's legacy, scanning the entire sky for nearby exoplanets.

name: James Webb Space Telescope
blurb: Most powerful space telescope ever built. Analyzes exoplanet atmospheres in unprecedented detail.

name: Parker Solar Probe
blurb: First spacecraft to 'touch' the Sun, helping us understand stellar behavior and its effects on planets.

name: New Horizons
blurb: First close-up images of Pluto and the Kuiper Belt, expanding our knowledge of the outer solar system.

name: Perseverance Rover
blurb: Searching for signs of ancient life on Mars and collecting samples for future return to Earth.
